plugins.name: Button Genie Pro
plugins.description:
Welcome to Button Genie Pro, the Figma plugin that instantly generates a fully featured button component set with every variant, state and Token, so you can focus on design, not tedious setup.


https://geniepro.app/


Quick Start


1. Create a new page in your Figma file where you want to place your button component set.

2. Run the plugin: Search for Button Genie Pro.

3. Follow the two-step UI to create variables and generate buttons.



Create Variables Foundations


On the first screen of the plugin, a single click generates 5 variable collections to lay the foundation of your button system. This makes updating your buttons much more flexible:

00 Primitives

01 Style Tokens

02 Semantic Colors

03 Sizing Tokens

04 Component Tokens

05 Typography



Preview and Generate Button Set


1. Light and Dark Mode: See your Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary buttons side by side in Light and Dark Mode. When you choose your Light or Dark Base Color, Button Genie Pro will automatically define the reverted color. (You can always tweaks colors later in your Figma Variables section).

2. Real-time Contrast Check always make sure your text meets WCAG AA or AAA standards.

3. Customize:

- Button text

- Stroke width for secondary button

- Horizontal/vertical padding, gap, and border radius

- Toggle variants: hover, focus, selected, disabled

- Add icon-only or pill-shaped buttons

4. Create Button Set: Click to generate up to 360 variants (3 types × 5 states × 2 shapes × 3 sizes × 4 content variants), a set of semantic buttons (Success, Warning, Error), and a set of placeholder icons. The base color you choose will be added to your custom color scale (myColor/randomName/50–900) in the Primitives variable collection.



Use Your Button Component


- All generated buttons are grouped into component sets in your document.

- Drag instances onto any frame and override text or icon as needed.

- Variables keep your design tokens flexible: update a token to cascade changes through every button.



Troubleshooting


- If you don't see new components:

  1. Ensure you've correctly generated variables/tokens at the first screen, before generating your button set.
  2. This plugin needs a Figma paid subscription to create Variable Modes. Make sure your have one. If not, the plugin will not work as expected.

- For manual hex input issues, make sure to include a leading `#` and six hex digits.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generates fully featured button component sets with variants & variables (tokens).

plugins.name: Automagic Scale Generator
plugins.description: Quickly generate and manage design tokens for color palettes, typography scales, and spacing systems. It provides an interactive UI to customize color variations (including transparencies), modular or linear type and spacing scales, and then creates Figma variables for seamless design system integration. Inspired by the Automatic CSS Framework for WordPress.
plugins.tagline: Generate and manage design tokens for color palettes, typography scales and spacing systems.

plugins.name: Private Comments – Personal Notes in Figma
plugins.description:
The first-of-its-kind plugin that lets you add private comments to any frame or layer in your file.


Whether you're jotting reminders, tracking feedback, or planning edits — Private Comments help you stay organized without cluttering your file or notifying your team.


🗂️ Attach comments to specific frames / layers

✅ Mark as done / not done

🧠 Keep thoughts to yourself — No public comments or notifications

🔍 Edit, or delete comments anytime

📦 All comments are saved in your file


Perfect for noting feedback, internal critiques, or just managing your mental checklist or ideas directly inside Figma.

accepted.name: Manas Manohar
accepted.description:
Fintech | Product Designer

I love the process of creation. The process of building something new...

plugins.tagline: Add private, personal notes to frames and layers – just for you.

plugins.name: Frame Manager
plugins.description:
A simple but powerful tool for organizing and fixing frames in Figma. Detect duplicates, fix naming issues, and ensure proper dimensions in your design files.

Full Description

Frame Manager helps you maintain clean and well-organized Figma files by providing essential tools for working with frames.

Key Features:

🔍 Duplicate Frame Detection & Removal

Instantly find frames with identical names

Option to automatically remove duplicates while keeping one instance

Clean up messy files by eliminating redundant elements

🏷️ Frame Name Standardization

Identify frames with non-standard naming conventions

Automatically fix frame names to follow consistent PascalCase format

Enforce naming consistency across your design system

📏 Size Optimization

Find frames with dimensions not divisible by 2

Fix frame sizes to ensure clean rendering on various displays

Find frames with non-power-of-2 dimensions for texture optimization

How It Works

Install the plugin and run it from the Plugins menu

Select the feature you need from the simple, intuitive interface

Get instant feedback as the plugin detects issues or fixes problems

Enjoy a cleaner, more organized Figma file

Perfect For

Design teams working on large files

Designers preparing assets for developers

Anyone who wants to maintain consistent naming and sizing in their designs

Technical Details

Lightweight and fast - analyzes your file without lag

Non-destructive - always gives you control over changes

Works with any Figma file containing frames

Maintain better design hygiene and save hours of manual cleanup with Frame Manager!


2025 - WildCard Studios - Art Department
plugins.tagline: Clean & organize frames: find duplicates, fix names, proper dimensions with one-click solutions.

plugins.name: Curly Arrows
plugins.description:
Curly Arrows - Point with Personality!


Add playful motion and hand-drawn charm to your Figma designs with Curly Arrows, a collection of quirky, artistic arrows.


Whether you're sketching a quick flow, highlighting key elements, or just adding some fun, these swishy arrows keep things clear and creative.


Pick your favorite color, adjust the stroke width, and make each arrow your own.

plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

122624.name: Figma Variable to Code
122624.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
122624.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Pancake Work
plugins.description:
Guideline (Vietnamese):

  1. Plugin giúp link figma design vào một issue của Pancake Work
  2. Các bước thực hiện:


  1. Vào Pancake Work copy link issue
  2. Chọn node cần gắn link, chú ý đánh dấu ready for dev cho node đó trước (nếu cần) (node nên là frame/section)
  3. Mở plugin Pancake Work, paste link issue vào ô đầu tiên (Plugin có lưu lại link với mỗi node)
  4. Click vào ô thứ 2, nhấn Cmd + L (với Mac), hoặc Ctrl + L (với Windows) để lấy link figma, rồi paste
  5. Nhấn Create/Update


Roadmap:

  1. Update English guideline
  2. Listen feedback from Pancake designers to improve
  3. Maybe link for Kanban
  4. Hmmm, I don't know...


Copyright 2024 Pancake
plugins.tagline: Link Figma designs to Pancake Work

plugins.name: Radial & Angular Blur FX
plugins.description:
Radial & Spin Blur is a professional Figma plugin that lets you add cinematic zoom or spin blurs in seconds while keeping full creative control.


Radial Blur (Zoom). Simulates rushing toward/away from a point (motion graphics, depth focus).

Spin Blur (Angular). Rotates pixels around a center (energetic, surreal visuals).

Anaglyph 3D (optional). Adds subtle red/cyan offset (retro depth accents).


Key features

  1. Live Preview – Resizable preview area shows the effect before you commit.
  2. 5 × 5 Focal-Point Grid – Pick any corner, edge, or true center.
  3. Smooth Intensity Slider – From whisper-soft haze to dramatic streaks.
  4. Large-Image Support – Works on layers / frames up to 1000 px with smart scaling.
  5. No Clipping – Padding logic prevents cut-offs even at high values or off-center points.
  6. One-Click Apply – Happy with the look? Hit Apply and you’re done.
  7. Modern UI – Fast, accessible, dark-mode aware.
  8. Usage Analytics – Pseudonymous event data is sent to Amplitude to improve performance and roadmap decisions (no personal identifiers are collected).


Typical workflow

  1. Select a layer or frame (≤ 1000 px).
  2. Pick Radial (Zoom) or Spin (Angular).
  3. Set the center on the 5×5 grid and adjust intensity.
  4. Preview the result live.
  5. Apply the blur — undo-friendly and non-destructive.


Perfect for

UI/UX designers, illustrators, social-media creators, or anyone who wants studio-grade motion blurs inside Figma.


Built with TypeScript, Figma Plugin API, and Amplitude telemetry for anonymous usage insights.
plugins.tagline: Zoom- or spin-style blur with live preview, 5×5 focal grid, anaglyph toggle, and one-click apply.

plugins.name: Toggle Visibility By Type
plugins.description:
Toggle Visibility by Type is designed to streamline your design workflow by allowing you to quickly toggle the visibility of selected layers based on their type.

Whether you’re working with 🖼️ images, 📝 text, 🔲 shapes, 🔗 paths, ↔️ lines, 📁 groups, or 📐 frames, this plugin provides an intuitive interface to control which elements are visible in your design. Simply select the layers or groups you want to modify, choose the layer type you want to toggle, and hit the ☑️ button.


This plugin is especially useful for managing complex designs and improving your efficiency in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly toggle visibility of selected layers by type!

99518.name: Toggle Visibility By Type
99518.description:
Toggle Visibility by Type is designed to streamline your design workflow by allowing you to quickly toggle the visibility of selected layers based on their type.

Whether you’re working with 🖼️ images, 📝 text, 🔲 shapes, 🔗 paths, ↔️ lines, 📁 groups, or 📐 frames, this plugin provides an intuitive interface to control which elements are visible in your design. Simply select the layers or groups you want to modify, choose the layer type you want to toggle, and hit the ☑️ button.


This plugin is especially useful for managing complex designs and improving your efficiency in Figma.
99518.tagline: Quickly toggle visibility of selected layers by type!

plugins.name: Inkblot Notes
plugins.description:
Inkblot Notes by Inkblot

Turn notes from Inkblot sessions into sticky notes in FigJam


New to Inkblot? See how you can simplify your research studies


How it works

1. Enter a session ID

2. Once submitted, all notes from the session are imported and organized by author and session time

You can import notes from multiple sessions into a single FigJam file

plugins.name: ex-portable
plugins.description:
Ex-portable is a super simple plug-in for Figma that allows you to pull export settings from a main component in a library to an instance. That’s all.


Get settings for selected instances

Select the instances you want to apply the export settings from a main component in a library for, and select this command.


Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.
plugins.tagline: Port your export settings from component to instance.

97644.name: ex-portable
97644.description:
Ex-portable is a super simple plug-in for Figma that allows you to pull export settings from a main component in a library to an instance. That’s all.


Get settings for selected instances

Select the instances you want to apply the export settings from a main component in a library for, and select this command.


Get settings for all instances

Got a lot of instances on your page? Select this command to apply export settings from their main components.
97644.tagline: Port your export settings from component to instance.

plugins.name: Easy Select
plugins.description:
Easy Select helps you expedite the tedious and repetitive selection workflows with handy 1-click shortcuts.


-> Simply select one item, then:

  1. Select its parent / children / siblings
  2. Select others with the same color, name, size, rotation ...


-> Or, select a few items, then:

  1. Filter down to those with a particular type, name...


-> Save your carefully curated selections as bookmarks for reuse.


-> Restore from a list of historical selections.


For questions or feedback, please email easy-select@smarter.town.
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one selection helper

plugins.name: Liquid Glass
plugins.description:
Liquid Glass creates high-fidelity, scalable glass effects for modern UI designs. Transform any component with sophisticated multi-layered glass effects that automatically scale to fit your design.


✨ Features:

- Light Mode and Dark Mode themes to match any design system

- Create pre-configured glass components or apply effects to existing designs

- Preserves original colors with adjustable opacity (optional)


Perfect for creating modern, elegant interfaces with depth and dimension. Whether you're designing tab bars, buttons, cards or custom components, Liquid Glass delivers Apple-inspired glass effects with just a few clicks.


Based on Apple's WWDC25 design language, this plugin brings the latest UI trends to your Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: Create stunning, scalable glass effects inspired by Apple's modern UI design

plugins.name: Sliding Text
plugins.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
plugins.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

129512.name: Sliding Text
129512.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
129512.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

plugins.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
plugins.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
plugins.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

129369.name: Select Matching Layers in Frame
129369.description:
Instantly find repeated frames or component instances within the same frame and edit them all at once.


Figma’s built-in “Select Matching Layers” feature only works across different frames. This plugin is similar but works within a single frame. Quickly select repeating elements within a single frame and adjust their properties, just like the multi-edit feature. For convenience I recommend setting up a custom shortcut for the plugin.


Pair with Master plugin

Turn matching layers into a single component in seconds with the Master plugin:

1. Use Select Matching Layers in Frame to find all repeated elements

2. Run Master → Create Component from Objects

3. Done. You’ll get a single, clean component with overrides preserved


Technical details:

  1. Select all instances of a component (including variants) when selecting an instance
  2. Select all layers with matching name and type when selecting any other layer
  3. Searches within the same frame only
  4. Select multiple objects within different frames, plugin will find all the matches


If you have any questions or feedback, please comment below!
129369.tagline: Instantly find, select and edit similar layers within a single frame

plugins.name: Combine Pages
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.
plugins.tagline: Merge pages. Archive cleanly.

128785.name: Combine Pages
128785.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.

plugins.name: Content Kit
plugins.description: his Figma plugin allows designers to quickly generate Nigerian-themed content directly within their projects, saving time and enhancing local relevance. The plugin includes customizable templates, authentic text content (e.g., Yoruba proverbs, Pidgin phrases, or local idioms), cultural icons, and elements inspired by Nigeria’s rich diversity. Whether designing for digital products, branding, or social media, the plugin ensures an authentic touch, fostering deeper connections with Nigerian audiences. Users can tweak settings to suit various languages, regions, and styles, making it a versatile tool for creative professionals.
plugins.tagline: Generate Nigerian names and more!

116144.name: Content Kit
116144.description: his Figma plugin allows designers to quickly generate Nigerian-themed content directly within their projects, saving time and enhancing local relevance. The plugin includes customizable templates, authentic text content (e.g., Yoruba proverbs, Pidgin phrases, or local idioms), cultural icons, and elements inspired by Nigeria’s rich diversity. Whether designing for digital products, branding, or social media, the plugin ensures an authentic touch, fostering deeper connections with Nigerian audiences. Users can tweak settings to suit various languages, regions, and styles, making it a versatile tool for creative professionals.

plugins.name: Side note
plugins.description:
Meet Side Note, your minimalist companion for organizing thoughts, ideas, and to-dos in style. Side Note is designed for simplicity, focus, and seamless integration with your creative workflow. Whether you're jotting down quick ideas or capturing important notes, Side Note keeps everything neat and accessible.


Key Features:


  1. Customizable Notes: Add titles, content, and importance labels to make each note unique.
  2. Smart Sizing: Flexible vertical layouts with precise padding for a polished design.
  3. Intuitive Interface: Clean, modern UI for a distraction-free note-taking experience.
  4. Important Labeling: Highlight key notes with an elegant "Important" tag for quick prioritization.
  5. Effortless Integration: Built for seamless use within Figma, perfect for designers on the go.
plugins.tagline: Quick Notes, Seamless Workflow.

117726.name: Side note
117726.description:

plugins.name: skinnerplugin
plugins.description:
Bring your CSS themes to life effortlessly with Skinner. This plugin empowers designers to create, manage, and apply consistent styles across all elements of their Figma projects with ease. By simply providing a CSS theme, Skinner instantly generates paint styles for backgrounds, text, and accents, enabling a streamlined and cohesive design workflow.


With Skinner, you can:


Generate and update styles in seconds.

Maintain a consistent design aesthetic across your projects.

Easily switch between different color themes and accents for versatile design needs.

Whether you’re designing for web, mobile, or any digital interface, Skinner ensures that your styles are always organized, professional, and ready for use.


Simplify. Style. Create. With Skinner.
plugins.tagline: Skinner - Seamless Style Generation for Figma

109676.description:

Whether you’re designing for web, mobile, or any digital interface, Skinner ensures that your styles are always organized, professional, and ready for use.


Simplify. Style. Create. With Skinner.
109676.tagline: Skinner - Seamless Style Generation for Figma

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin does not require network access.

109546.release_notes:
Version 2.0.0 Updates:
- Added support for multiple independent counters
- Use {n1}, {n2}, {n3} etc. for different number sequences
- All counters increment automatically
- Maintained backward compatibility with {n} syntax
- Improved error handling and performance
109546.tagline: A simple text generator for scaling design

plugins.name: Easily Name output
plugins.description:
Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "▼". For example: "▼page-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Step 2: Export


Select the nodes to be exported.

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "▼" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).
plugins.tagline: Replace Export Names for Figma Frame Types

92594.name: Easily Name output
92594.description:
Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "▼". For example: "▼page-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Step 2: Export


Select the nodes to be exported.

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "▼" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).
92594.tagline: Replace Export Names for Figma Frame Types

plugins.name: Zero Me
plugins.description:
Zero Me: Center Your Starting Point


Start designing from anywhere on the canvas, and when you're ready, let Zero Me center your creations. Simply select your frames and objects, run the plugin, and Zero Me will position your designs at coordinates (0, 0), keeping your canvas clean and organized.


Zero Me is a small but mighty Figma plugin that simplifies the process of centering and aligning your designs. It's for designers who want to maintain a tidy workspace and ensure a consistent starting point for their projects.


Key Features:

1. Center Alignment: Zero Me sets the position of your selected frames and objects to coordinates (0, 0), providing a centered starting point for your designs.

2. Multiple Object Support: Select multiple frames and objects, and Zero Me will align them all to the center of the canvas.


Install Zero Me and experience the convenience of a centered starting point for your Figma designs.


Created by Taryn + Claude 3 Opus
plugins.tagline: Center you Frames, Objects, Sections, and Self 🧘

85268.name: Zero Me
85268.description:
Zero Me: Center Your Starting Point


Start designing from anywhere on the canvas, and when you're ready, let Zero Me center your creations. Simply select your frames and objects, run the plugin, and Zero Me will position your designs at coordinates (0, 0), keeping your canvas clean and organized.


Zero Me is a small but mighty Figma plugin that simplifies the process of centering and aligning your designs. It's for designers who want to maintain a tidy workspace and ensure a consistent starting point for their projects.


Key Features:

1. Center Alignment: Zero Me sets the position of your selected frames and objects to coordinates (0, 0), providing a centered starting point for your designs.

2. Multiple Object Support: Select multiple frames and objects, and Zero Me will align them all to the center of the canvas.


Install Zero Me and experience the convenience of a centered starting point for your Figma designs.


Created by Taryn + Claude 3 Opus
85268.tagline: Center you Frames, Objects, Sections, and Self 🧘

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————


🫶 Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets
plugins.tagline: Prototype usability analytics right inside Figma

plugins.name: Components Explorer
plugins.description:
Component Explorer allows you to easily locate and manage all your components, both local and remote, and easily find all their instances.


**Key Features:**


• View all your components in one place, organized by name or grouped by page


• Quickly filter between local and remote components


• Find specific components with instant search


• Locate all instances of a component with a single click


• Navigate directly to any component or instance in your document


Thanks for your feedback!


https://buymeacoffee.com/4bulxx2uho

accepted.description: Hello! 🚀 I'm Alex Salmerón, a Product Designer (UX/UI) specializing in Design Systems.

plugins.tagline: Locate and manage your components and instances effortlessly

133171.description:
Component Explorer allows you to easily locate and manage all your components, both local and remote, and easily find all their instances.


**Key Features:**


• View all your components in one place, organized by name or grouped by page


• Quickly filter between local and remote components


• Find specific components with instant search


• Locate all instances of a component with a single click

plugins.name: Import large image(s)
plugins.description:
When posting full page screenshots into FigJam, the images would be blurry and unreadable because Figma automatically reduces image sizes when the height or width is over 4096px. Not anymore!


As a workaround, this plugin

  1. slices the original image into multiple images
  2. groups the sliced images together to create one cohesive image


What makes this plugin different from the others?

  1. The ability to import multiple images at once


If you like it, buy me a beer 🍻
plugins.tagline: Import large image(s) into Figma and Figjam, maintaining resolution and size.

plugins.name: Fig Toolkit
plugins.description:
Fig Toolkit is your all-in-one Figma companion, focused on helping designers sort, align, and organise their workspace faster and more intuitively. With powerful sorting tools, renaming capabilities, and precise alignment options, you can bring structure and clarity to any design layout. For those managing text consistency, the toolkit also scans and identifies unstyled or mixed text layers, making it easy to apply or update text styles.


🔹 Easily sort and rename layers

🔹 Precisely align elements with adjustable spacing

🔹 Wrap layers into new sections with custom padding

🔹 Reorder layers directly in the layers panel

🔹 Detect mixed or unstyled fonts

🔹 View and fix text layers missing styles

🔹 Apply or update text styles quickly

🔹 Streamline your design workflow with ease
plugins.tagline: Sort, Align & Manage Styles in Figma Effortlessly

plugins.name: Frame Toggler
plugins.description: Problem : When presenting a solution, explaining the main workflow while showcasing multiple design options for each page can clutter the view. Solution : Use this tool to collapse alternative pages in the main workflow, displaying only the first option initially. After presenting the main flow, click a toggle button to expand all pages for detailed discussions
plugins.tagline: Toggle Frame show/hide

plugins.name: Notes
plugins.description:
Notes is a Figma plugin designed to streamline collaboration between designers, project managers, and engineers. It enhances the design handoff process by providing a structured way to document and share feedback directly within Figma. Whether you're annotating designs, adding development notes, or organizing project details, Notes ensures seamless communication and clarity across teams.

With Notes, design handoff becomes more efficient, reducing miscommunication and making it easier for teams to align on project goals.

accepted.name: TemiTope Aiyegbusi
accepted.description: designing for the next billion users.

plugins.tagline: Seamless Collaboration, Effortless Handoff

plugins.name: Stockpress
plugins.description:
About

Welcome to the Stockpress plugin for Figma, where you can quickly find and add files from your Stockpress workspace to your Figma designs. Once ready, export Frames and images back to Stockpress - complete with Frame URLs for easy access to working files!


What is Stockpress?

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management system–for everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co
plugins.tagline: Add files from your Stockpress workspace to your design and export Figma assets back once ready

136760.name: Stockpress
136760.description:

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management system–for everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co
136760.tagline: Add files from your Stockpress workspace to your design and export Figma assets back once ready

plugins.name: Hive
plugins.description:
Tired of endless swiping, cluttered frames, and struggling to stay focused?

Say hello to Hive, the ultimate Figma plugin designed to transform your design process. With its minimalist approach and powerful features, Hive ensures a smoother, more organized, and efficient workflow for designers and teams alike. Perfect for those working on complex projects with multiple screens and teams presenting designs or collaborating on organized workspaces.


Key Features

🗂 Create Categories: Group frames into organized categories for a streamlined workflow.

🔍 Zoom-In Functionality: Quickly focus on specific categories, making navigation seamless.

🎯 Smooth Screen Presentation: Eliminate the frustration of moving around messy frames while presenting. Hive ensures a clean, irritation-free presentation experience.

⚡ Simplified Workflow: Minimalist, easy-to-use interface that saves time and effort.

🔄 Quick Frame Switching: Easily switch between frames without excessive swiping, allowing for a faster and more efficient workflow as you move through different tasks.


Why This Plugin?

When working on large design files, scrolling endlessly, searching for frames, or jumping between screens during team presentations can be chaotic and jarring to the eye. Hive eliminates the frustration by organizing frames into clear categories and enabling zoom-in functionality. Whether you're working alone or presenting designs to your team, Hive keeps your workspace smooth, clean, and irritation-free.

🚀 Boost Productivity: Spend less time navigating and more time designing.

🗂️ Stay Organized: Keep your navigation intuitive without modifying your file structure.

🎯 Improve Focus: Streamline your workflow to maintain momentum on your creative projects.

🤝 Enhance Collaboration: Share organized and easy-to-navigate files with your team, fostering better teamwork and understanding.

⏳ Save Time: Glide’s intuitive features reduce the time spent on repetitive tasks, giving you more room for creativity.


Ready to Hive? Try it out now and watch your productivity soar. Let your designs flow effortlessly. Organize, focus, and present without distractions.
plugins.tagline: Hive: Organise. Categorise. Focus.

plugins.name: Wrighty
plugins.description:
Meet Wrighty – your go-to Figma plugin for instant, AI-powered content generation! Imagine filling all your screens with perfectly crafted text in seconds. Wrighty doesn’t just generate words; it adapts them. From landing pages to app flows, Wrighty intuitively matches your specified tone and context, creating unique, on-brand content for every screen you design.


Forget hours spent drafting and editing copy. With Wrighty, just a few clicks auto-generate clear, compelling text that resonates with your target audience. Need to rephrase content across multiple screens? No problem—Wrighty does it all, maintaining consistency and quality to let you focus on design.


Why Wrighty? It’s fast, smart, and seamless. Wrighty empowers you to scale your creative output, delivering screen-ready content that’s as polished as your visuals. Join thousands of Figma users who have already leveled up their workflow with Wrighty. Generate more, customize better, and design faster with Wrighty—the content engine that keeps up with your creativity!
plugins.tagline: AI-powered assistant for all UX writing needs.
